etymologies: mid 16th century: from medieval Latin, from Old Italian tarantola ‘tarantula’, from the name of the seaport Taranto. Compare with tarantella and tarantism

definitions: a large hairy spider found chiefly in tropical and subtropical America, some kinds of which are able to catch small lizards, frogs, and birds.

notes.text: Family Theraphosidae, suborder Mygalomorphae: numerous species

shortDefinitions: very large hairy spider found chiefly in tropical and subtropical America

definitions: a large black wolf spider of southern Europe, whose bite was formerly believed to cause tarantism.
shortDefinitions: large black wolf spider of southern Europe, whose bite was formerly believed to cause tarantism
